name: Longford

screenshots.caption: Longford makes it easy to make 2-D games and apps using Lua.

short_description:
Longford is an open source Lua-based games platform designed to allow easy creation of apps for practically any device that supports C++ and OpenGL (we are now preparing a DirectX version too!). Longford also incorporates Box2D allowing realistic physics to be added to your games and apps. Longford is designed to be as platform agnostic as possible. Currently it can output native apps for Windows and BlackBerry PlayBook (and BB OS10 phones). However, since the code is available open source, it can be ported to any operating system and device and we encourage people to do this. Soon, Longford will support Windows Phone 8, stay tuned!

With Longford you can write your app once in Lua and then export it for any platform that Longford supports. You do not need to change the Lua code when recompiling for different targets. Thus Longford is a truly cross platform programming system. Write once, run anywhere!
summary: A cross platform Lua based game engine
